subject: TXCL
name: Directed Rsch in Tox
info: Special project that addresses specific issue in toxicology. Under guidance of faculty member.prereq: instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Principles of Tox
info: Introduction to fundamentals of poisoning in individuals and the environment, assessment of potential health hazards, and application of toxicology in various professional careers.prereq: Grad txcl major or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Priciples of Toxicology
info: Science of toxicology. Biomedical principles. Regulatory practices governing protection of human health and environmental quality.prereq: At least one semester [biochemistry, calculus, cell biology]; at least one semester of [human or animal] physiology recommended

subject: TXCL
name: Chemical Toxicology
info: Signs, symptoms, and mechanism of toxicity of different classes of chemicals spanning several organ systems, including chemical carcinogenesis.prereq: 5012, instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: NanoToxicology
fullname: Molecular and Cellular Basis of Nanoparticle Toxicology
info: Introduction to science of nanotoxicology. Nanotechnology in scientific research. Assessment of impact on biological systems.prereq: Introductory toxicology course

subject: TXCL
name: Vet Tox
info: Toxicology of minerals, pesticides, venoms, and various toxins. Identification of poisonous plants. Recognition, diagnosis, and treatment of animal poisons.prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Intro to Regulatory Medicine
info: Explanation of products requiring pre-market approval and those that may be marketed without approval. Post-market surveillance. Adverse reactions, removal of product from market.prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Advanced Tox I
info: Absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion of xenobiotics; toxicokinetics; mechanisms of toxicity or specific classes of chemical agents.prereq: 5011 or BioC 4331, PubH 5104 or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Advanced Tox II
info: Kinetic and dynamic determinants of target organ toxicity; pathological alterations in structure/function relationships for major target organ systems; mechanisms of mutagenesis, carcinogenesis, and teratogenesis.prereq: 8012, BioC 4332, Phsl 5062 or Phsl 6101 or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: Investigative Tox
info: Evaluating toxicology research issues and literature.prereq: 8013 or instr consent

subject: TXCL
name: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: TXCL
name: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: TXCL
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr
info: tbdprereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: TXCL
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: TXCL
name: Thesis Credit:Doct*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
